sngxv.question: With the Centre (CTR) tank FUEL PUMP switches ON, if an amber LOW PRESSURE light illuminates, it also immediately illuminates MASTER CAUTION and a FUEL system annunciator lights.

dmbgx.question: Which fuel valves are Flight Crew made aware of their position by means of flight deck indications?

options.text: Fuel valves are automatic with no flight deck indications.
Engine Fuel Shutoff valves, Spar Fuel Shutoff valves, Crossfeed valve, Centre, No1 and No2 tanks Fuel Pump valves.
Centre, No1 and No2 Tanks Fuel Pump Valves, Engine Fuel Shutoff Valve, Cross Feed valve.
Engine Fuel Shutoff valves, Spar Fuel Shutoff valves, Crossfeed valve.

b0x43h.question: After the Centre Tank has emptied the auto shutoff logic stops the pumps, how do the pumps then function?

options.text: There is no shutoff logic, the pumps continue to run with the amber LOW PRESSURE light illuminated until the Flight Crew switch the pumps to OFF.
Switching the pumps to OFF and then back to ON recycles the auto shutoff logic and the pumps will again activate.
The pumps will not funtion again until the Centre tank has been refueled above 453 kg.
The pumps can be activated if necessary by tripping the auto shutoff circuit breaker on Panel P6-1 behind the First Officer.

rk57d.question: What is the correct sequence regarding the SPAR VALVE CLOSED light during a normal engine start procedure after the START LEVER is positioned to IDLE detent?

options.text: Transitions from extinguished to bright.
Transitions from extinguished to dim.
Transitions from dim, to bright and then extinguishes.
Transitions from extinguished, to bright and then dim.

8jjax.question: In flight a fuel imbalance between No1 and No2 tanks can be corrected by:

options.text: Increase thrust setting on the side with higher amount of fuel and decrease thrust setting on side with lower amount of fuel.

Opening the crossfeed valve, turning OFF the fuel pumps for the tank with lower fuel and allowing the pumps from the tank with the higher amount of fuel to transfer fuel to the other tank until the IMBAL amber warning light extinguishes, then close the Crossfeed valve and turn back on the pumps.
Open the Crossfeed cock, turn off the pumps on the low side until the Fuel Quantity Indicators are balanced.
A Fuel imablance cannot be rectified in flight, as fuel transfer between tanks can only be carried out on the ground using the Ground Refuelling Panel switches.

ywi5j.question: The fuel imbalance alert is only displayed when the aircraft is in the air.

bevph.question: Where is the fuel temperature sensor located?

options.text: In each engine Hydro-Mechanical fuel control unit.
1 in the inboard rear of each main tank
In each engine supply line adjacent to the Fuel Flow Meter
In the No1 main tank.

fh375.question: For landing, what is the maximum fuel imbalance between the No.1 and No.2 main tanks?

options.text: 653 Kgs.
553 Kgs.
453 Kgs.
726 Kgs.

o5tbdl.question: How many fuel pumps does each tank have, and where are they located?

options.text: The centre tank has 2 AC pumps located on the forward wall of the centre tank.  The No1 main tank has 2 AC pumps located on the rear wall of the No1 tank.  The No2 main tank has 2 AC pumps located on the rear wall of the No2 tank.

The centre tank has 2 AC fuel pumps mounted on the rear wall of the centre tank.  The No1 tank has 2 AC pumps mounted in the centre tank - 1 on the front wall and one one the rear wall.  The No2 tank has 2 AC pumps mounted in the centre tank - 1 on the front wall and 1 on the rear wall.  There is also a Jet pump mounted in the centre tank discharging into No1 tank

The centre tank has 1 AC fuel pump located on the front wall of the centre tank and 1 located on the rear wall of the centre tank.  The No1 main tank has 1 pump located on the rear wall of the No1 tank and 1 pump located on the front wall of the No1 tank .  The No2 tank has 1 pump located on the rear wall of the No2 tank and 1 pump located on the front wall of the No2 tank..

The centre tank has 2 AC pumps located on the forward wall of the centre tank.  The No1 main tank has 1 AC pump located on the rear wall of the No1 tank.  The No2 main tank has 1 AC pump located on the rear wall of the No2 tank.

kf90w.question: What are the USABLE FUEL capacities of the aircraft fuel tanks?

options.text: Centre = 12,726kg, No1 = 3,453kg, No2 = 3,453kg.
Centre = 3915kg, No1 = 13,066kg , No2 = 13,066kg
Centre 13,066kg, No1 = 3,915kg, No2 = 3,915kg.
Centre = 20,025 ltr, No1 = 4,876 ltr, No2 = 4,876 ltr

2mv9mk.question: What does a blue light mean on the Nitrogen Generation System (NGS).

options.text: Dim blue means NGS valve agrees with commanded position.
Bright blue means NGS valve closed or disagrees with commanded position
Bright blue means NGS valve closed.
NGS system functioning in a degraded condition.

tygrs.question: What operates the spar fuel shutoff valve?

options.text: Pushrods and cranks
DC motor from Hot Battery Bus
Cables and pulleys
AC motor from Standby Bus

iowqz.question: With the engines running, the fuel CONFIG alert will be displayed by the No1 and No2 Fuel Quantity Indicators turning Amber, when the Centre tank quantity is greater than 726kg and the Centre tank pump switches are off

lq8pp.question: In the unlikely situation of total generator failure, at high altitude thrust deterioration may occur. Why?

options.text: The fuel will be suction fed, which may cause dissolved air released from the fuel to restrict fuel flow in the suction feed line.
Loss of AC power will affect the ignition system and therefore create a potential risk of flameout
When on STBY power the fuel pumps run a little slower
When on STBY power the HMU will be unreliable, therefore thrust deterioration might occur at high altitude

l3xfa.question: With the engines running, the fuel CONFIG alert will be displayed by the No1 and No2 Fuel Quantity Indicators turning Amber, when the Centre tank quantity is greater than 726kg and the Centre tank pump switches are off

zd7yq.question: During cruise you note both center tank fuel pumps have failed as indicated by the illumination of both center tank fuel pump LOW PRESSURE lights. You still have 320 kg of fuel in the center tank and both main tanks are full. You will see:

options.text: a CONFIG indication on the CDS
a LOW indication on the CDS
a pump LOW PRESSURE indication on the CDS
There will be no indication on CDS

wk8ff.question: During an engine start , when an engine start lever is positioned to IDLE detent, which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The related blue SPAR VALVE CLOSED light transitions from dim to extinguished.
The related blue SPAR VALVE CLOSED light transitions from extinguished, to bright, and then dim.
The related blue SPAR VALVE CLOSED light transitions from dim, to bright, and then extinguished.
The related SPAR VALVE CLOSED light is unaffected by the engine start lever position.

opw5a.question: The amber fuel IMBAL alert will remain displayed until the imbalance is reduced to:-

options.text: 91 kgs
726 kgs
363 kgs
453 kgs

ddn9z.question: What is the indication of the Crossfeed VALVE OPEN Light when the CROSSFEED selector is positioned OPEN and the crossfeed valve is closed?

options.text: illuminated amber
illuminated bright blue
illuminated dim blue
extinguished

x5lmn.question: The center tank fuel scavenge jet pump operates when:

options.text: either engine is operating
the center fuel tank is about 3/4 full
both Center Tank Fuel Pump Switches are turned OFF
the No. 1 main fuel tank is about 1/2 full

a36wg.question: How many fuel measuring sticks are installed?

whgm6.question: During cruise both centre tank fuel pumps have failed. There is still 460 kg in the centre tank, and both main tanks are full. The upper Display Unit will show:

options.text: A LOW Alert indication under centre tank.
A CONFIG Alert indication.
There will be no indication on the CDS
A pump low pressure indication.

ur51c.question: When the engine start lever is placed to CUTOFF:-

options.text: The engine fuel shutoff valve only closes.
The spar fuel shutoff valve only closes.
The spar fuel shutoff valve and engine fuel shutoff valve both close.
The spar fuel shutoff valve, engine fuel shutoff valve and engine bypass valve all close.

krs72.question: What is the source of electrical power for the engine fuel shutoff valves?

options.text: the Hot Battery Bus
the Battery Bus
the DC Standby Bus
the AC Standby Bus

cxkho.question: In-flight, the two fuel pump LOW PRESSURE Lights for main tank No.1 illuminate. What happens to the No.1 engine?

options.text: it receives fuel from main tank No.1 through a suction feed line that bypasses the pumps
it receives fuel from main tank No. 2 automatically
it will shut down due to fuel starvation
it continues to operate due to the metering of fuel by the Fuel Control Unit
